outline.text: What is this?
feedBase is a project to get feeds into a database.
All info you upload is public
This is important.
All information you upload to this feedBase is public.
Do not upload private information.
This is a publishing system and a way of sharing information. By definition it's all public. That's the point of uploading the information.
Logging in

We use Twitter for identity. We will not post anything on your behalf. The only information we access through Twitter is your public profile, which may be used to set defaults for preferences in feedBase.
You can use feedBase with or without logging in. You must be logged in to upload subscription lists, or to subscribe to or unsubscribe from feeds.
How to
Upload your OPML file.
Export your subscription list in whatever RSS reader or podcast client you use.
In feedBase, sign in with Twitter and drag-drop your OPML file onto the Upload icon in the menu bar. You can also click the icon to get a dialog where you choose the OPML file to upload.
You can watch a short video demo that shows how to do this.
Browse the network
Start with the hotlist, it's on the home page of the feedBase site.
Click on one of the feeds to get to its feed description page.
Click on a subscriber name to see the feeds they subscribe to.
See what you're subscribed to
Choose Show my subs in the Main menu.
More info

I wrote a vision statement for the project on my blog. It's a bootstrap. A Hail Mary pass. A chicken and egg thing. I hope people who make feed readers make it so that people can subscribe to OPML lists, so there can be an explosion of new applications that use feeds. The subscriptions have been too hard to get to. This was part of the original vision for RSS>
